arts.ttl: World media reacts as Celtic 'breeze' turns into a hurricane and Carter-Vickers Brugge blunder goes global
arts.sum: Celtic battled to a valuable Champions League point and outlets across the globe have had plenty to say

arts.ttl: Chris Sutton reacts to Celtic's 'tremendous' Champions League point vs Club Brugge
arts.sum: Celtic did find their equaliser after Daizen Maeda’s superb curling shot levelled the scores but in the end, they just couldn’t find another goal in them as they shared the points with their Champions League opponents. Chris Sutton lauds ‘tremendous’ Daizen Maeda in Celtic’s Champions League stalemate vs Club Brugge

arts.ttl: Johan Mjallby pinpoints 'only disappointment' from Celtic in Club Brugge stalemate
arts.sum: Johan Mjallby felt Celtic were lucky to take a point from this evening’s Champions League tie against Club Brugge. Johan Mjallby says Celtic did not create enough at home to win the game

arts.ttl: How resilient Celtic got back into game after disastrous own goal
arts.sum: Watch Match of the Day pundits analyse Celtic's performance in their 1-1 draw against Club Brugge as the Scottish Champions showed 'resilience' to come back from their early own goal 'disaster'.

arts.ttl: Auston Trusty opens up on Huddle 'wake-up' call and 'p****d off' Celtic dressing room
arts.sum: Auston Trusty has revealed what was said during the impromptu Huddle in the Club Brugge game and why the Celtic dressing room was "p****d off".

arts.ttl: Brendan Rodgers unmoved by Celtic dropped points as boss' glass half-full mentality bears 'really good place' verdict
arts.sum: But despite some fans showing their annoyance at the draw throughout the game, Rodgers refused to lay down and scorn his players, instead lauding them for a superb second half and despite failing to turn one point into three, the Northern Irishman reminded fans that the club are still on track to finish in the play-off stages of the competition. Get the latest news sent straight to your messages by joining our Celtic WhatsApp community today.

arts.ttl: Auston Trusty reveals Celtic dressing room rage but Cameron Carter Vickers NOT the target
arts.sum: Trusty had no anger towards his fellow American after first half howler pout Celtic in a hole they managed to climb out of

arts.ttl: Maeda strike earns Celtic draw against Club Brugge after 'nightmare' own goal
arts.sum: Watch highlights as Celtic keep their Champions League dreams alive with a hard-fought draw against Club Brugge after going a goal down to a "horror" own goal from Cameron Carter-Vickers.

arts.ttl: Pundits react to Celtic Champions League draw with 'valuable point' quip as trio labelled as poor
arts.sum: It wasn't quite the vintage Celtic performance that fans were hoping for, as the Hoops drew 1-1 at home to Club Brugge on a tough Champions League night at Parkhead - but pundits have noted that any point is a 'valuable' point at this stage in the tournament as the group stage moved into its latter stages. Join Football Scotland's Celtic WhatsApp community!

arts.ttl: Celtic earn Champions League point after comedy own goal against Club Brugge
arts.sum: Celtic 1-1 Club Brugge: Brendan Rodgers praised Cameron Carter-Vickers and his side’s mentality after recovering from a disastrous own goal
